title: Myths you learned in health class

title: How well do masks work?

multiple-choice.question: How is COVID-19 spread through the air?

options.label: A
options.text: Through direct contact with an infected person.

options.label: B
options.text: Through air currents carrying microscopic droplets full of the coronavirus.

options.label: D
options.text: Through the bites of infected insects.

multiple-choice.question: What technique is used in the video to demonstrate how masks work?
In what two ways do masks help to slow the spread of COVID-19?

options.label: A
options.text: By preventing larger droplets from evaporating and by reducing the momentum of droplets that get through.

options.label: B
options.text: By blocking all viral particles and by reducing the number of droplets released when talking.

options.label: C
options.text: By lowering body oxygen levels and by reducing the temperature of the air.

options.label: D
options.text: By increasing the speed of air currents and by reducing the amount of moisture in the air.

multiple-choice.question: Can masks lower body oxygen levels?

options.label: C
options.text: It depends on the type of mask.

multiple-choice.question: What is the importance of wearing masks in combination with other safety measures?

options.label: A
options.text: They are not necessary and can be replaced by handwashing alone.

options.label: B
options.text: are not effective in reducing the spread of COVID-19.

options.label: C
options.text: are best used in combination with other safety measures, such as handwashing and physical distancing.

options.label: D
options.text: are only necessary for people with compromised immune systems.

multiple-choice.question: What message does wearing a mask send?
Why is it important to wear a mask?

options.label: A
options.text: To protect oneself from getting sick.

options.label: B
options.text: To protect others from getting sick.

options.label: D
options.text: To send a message that we're all in this together.

multiple-choice.question: What is the most important thing to do during a pandemic?

options.label: A
options.text: Stay at home and avoid contact with others.

options.label: B
options.text: Wear a mask and follow safety measures.

options.label: C
options.text: Stay informed and follow the advice of health experts.

multiple-choice.question: Can shaming people into wearing masks be effective?
What is the best way to approach the issue of wearing masks?

options.label: A
options.text: With an open mind and an open heart.

options.label: B
options.text: With a closed mind and a closed heart.

title: Am I Really A Visual Learner?

multiple-choice.question: What is the main idea presented in the video about learning styles?

options.label: A
options.text: Learning styles are an inherent trait that affects how well students learn.

options.label: B
options.text: Multiple presentation formats, especially visual aids, can help most people learn.

options.label: C
options.text: Students learn best when they are taught in their preferred style.

options.label: D
options.text: Learning styles are not relevant to academic success.

multiple-choice.question: What was the outcome of a 2008 review of studies on learning styles?

options.label: A
options.text: The review found that most studies supported the idea that students learn best with their preferred style.

options.label: B
options.text: The review found that only one study supported the idea that students learn best with their preferred style.

options.label: C
options.text: The review found that learning styles had no impact on academic success.

options.text: The review found that the concept of learning styles was irrelevant.

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: C
options.text: Students who heard and saw the words remembered them equally well.

options.label: D
options.text: Students who heard the words remembered them better than those who saw the words.

options.label: A
options.text: Students who read plain text learned the concepts better.

options.label: B
options.text: Students who viewed pictures learned the concepts better.

options.label: C
options.text: Students who read plain text and viewed pictures learned the concepts equally well.

options.label: D
options.text: Students who read plain text and viewed pictures learned the concepts better.

multiple-choice.question: What is the implication of the findings about learning styles?

options.label: A
options.text: Learning styles are an inherent trait that affects how well students learn.

options.label: B
options.text: Multiple presentation formats, especially visual aids, can help most people learn.

options.label: C
options.text: Students learn best when they are taught in their preferred style.

options.label: D
options.text: Learning styles are not relevant to academic success.

multiple-choice.question: What did the researchers conclude about the concept of learning styles?

options.label: A
options.text: Learning styles are an inherent trait that affects how well students learn.

options.label: B
options.text: Learning styles are not an inherent trait, but a preference that can be influenced by teaching methods.

options.label: C
options.text: Learning styles are not relevant to academic success.

options.label: D
options.text: The concept of learning styles is irrelevant.

multiple-choice.question: What did the researchers suggest as a more effective way to teach students?

options.label: A
options.text: Teaching students in their preferred style.

options.label: B
options.text: Teaching students in multiple ways, including visual aids.

options.label: C
options.text: Teaching students through a single method.

multiple-choice.question: What did one study find about how students who saw words in print performed compared to those who only heard the words?

options.label: A
options.text: Students who saw words in print performed worse.

options.label: B
options.text: Students who saw words in print performed equally well.

options.label: C
options.text: Students who saw words in print performed better.

options.label: D
options.text: The study did not find a difference.

multiple-choice.question: What is the overall message of the video about learning styles?

options.label: A
options.text: Learning styles are an inherent trait that affects how well students learn.

options.label: B
options.text: Multiple presentation formats, especially visual aids, can help most people learn.

options.label: C
options.text: Students learn best when they are taught in their preferred style.

title: Why does smoke follow you around a fire?

multiple-choice.question: What is the main reason why air rises near a fire?

options.label: A
options.text: Because it weighs less dense than the surrounding air.

options.label: B
options.text: Because it weighs less than the air it replaces.

options.label: C
options.text: Because of the presence of smoke.

options.label: D
options.text: Because of the heat from the fire.

multiple-choice.question: What happens to dense objects in a fire?

options.label: C
options.text: They stay in the same place.

multiple-choice.question: What is the effect of people standing near a fire?

options.label: A
options.text: They cause the fire to burn more intensely.

options.label: B
options.text: They create a kind of vacuum that pushes air towards the fire.

options.label: D
options.text: They have no effect on the fire.

multiple-choice.question: What is the purpose of smokeless fire pits?

options.label: B
options.text: To reduce or eliminate the amount of smoke produced by a fire.

multiple-choice.question: What happens when people are spaced out equally around a fire?

options.label: B
options.text: The air is pushed towards the fire more strongly.

options.label: C
options.text: The air is pushed towards the fire equally from all directions.

multiple-choice.question: What is the main reason why smoke is blown towards people near a fire?

options.label: A
options.text: Because of the heat from the fire.

options.label: B
options.text: Because of the presence of people.

options.label: D
options.text: Because of the type of wood used in the fire.

multiple-choice.question: What can people do to avoid getting smoke in their eyes and lungs?

options.label: B
options.text: Stand alone rather than huddled with their friends.

options.label: D
options.text: Cover their faces with a cloth.

multiple-choice.question: What is the effect of having more people in one place near a fire?

options.label: B
options.text: The air is pushed towards the fire less strongly.

options.label: C
options.text: The air is pushed towards the fire more strongly.

options.label: A

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D
